title: I’m a Fashion Editor With Expensive Taste—21 New-In M&S Buys That Have My Full Attention Right Now
excerpt: I have expensive taste but a high-street budget, and when I'm looking for pieces that give off a designer vibe, I always head to M&S. Click here for the most expensive-looking M&S buys I've spotted this week.
text: Sponsor Content Created With M&S With each new season comes a chance to give my wardrobe a little refresh, but let's be honest: most of us aren't here for an endless rotation of trends. Over the years, I've crafted a capsule wardrobe that relies on timeless staples. These pieces work hard year-round, but when winter rolls around, I love to add just a few select items that elevate the essentials I already own. For me, it's all about finding those refined, quietly luxurious pieces that seamlessly update my look without overpowering it. And truly, only a handful of high-street brands consistently deliver on this vision, with Marks and Spencer sitting firmly at the top of my list. The brand's winter collection is especially enticing this year—think effortless layers, rich textures and classic silhouettes that look and feel far more premium than their price tags suggest.(Image credit: M&S)M&S has been my go-to for winter classics that keep me both cosy and chic for a few years now. There's something about the brand's approach to timeless design that just gets it right; every piece is well-made, comfortable and easy to style. I have a cashmere crew-neck jumper from last season that's seen me through countless dinners, events and off-duty weekends, and it still looks as impeccable as the day I bought it. And it's not just about style, it's the way these pieces fit into a busy lifestyle without feeling like high-maintenance fashion. The versatility and practicality of M&S pieces make them ideal for my winter wardrobe, especially as my calendar fills up with occasions where looking put-together is a must.(Image credit: M&S)This season, I'm focusing on adding minimalist pieces that feel quietly expensive—the kind of items that whisper elegance rather than shout it. Think crisp tailoring, rich neutral hues and fabrics that elevate an outfit without much accessorising. Two of my standout picks are the Double Breasted Short Peacoat with Wool (£65), which is perfect for transitioning from casual lunches to evening events with ease, and the Cable Knit Roll Neck Jumper (£35) for the warmth and texture I crave in the colder months.After spending a good few hours scouring the M&S website, below, I've rounded up my favourite winter pieces that exude that high-end feel.Shop My Favourite Classic Winter Pieces From M&S: M&S Collection Double Breasted Short Peacoat With Wool This pea coat has a slightly oversized yet tailored cut—ideal for layering over knits on cold days. M&S Collection High Waisted Crease Front Slim Flare Jeans Jeans work hard year-round in my wardrobe, and I want to try a subtle flare cut this season. Autograph Pure Cashmere Textured Crew Neck Jumper This super-soft jumper is available in a range of shades from oat to deep navy. I can see myself pairing it with tailored trousers or a leather skirt for multiple sophisticated, fuss-free winter looks. M&S Collection Lyocell Rich Pleated Wide Leg Trousers A chic wide-leg silhouette that reminds me of classic Celine tailoring. These trousers come in black and grey and would look amazing with ankle boots and a tucked-in slim-fit roll neck. Autograph Wool Blend Pinstripe Cropped Blazer Cropped blazers are a clever trick to make any outfit look more expensive. Plus, they're so easy to style with jeans or over a slip dress for an easy layered look. Autograph Wool Blend Pinstripe Tapered Trousers The matching pinstripe trousers will turn it into a chic office look. M&S Collection Leather Chisel Toe Knee High Boots These sleek knee-high boots are an example of timeless footwear that works with almost any outfit. M&S Collection Ribbed Roll Neck Jumper Cosy yet refined, this jumper comes in a range of neutrals plus orange and green. The roll neck adds a little extra warmth without feeling too bulky, which also makes it perfect for layering. M&S Collection Single Breasted Longline Tailored Coat This coat combines elegance and comfort with its single-breasted button fastening and oversized lapels. A classic pared-back outerwear option, you'll reach for it all season. M&S Collection The Wide-Leg Jeans Affordable, versatile and not too wide, if you're yet to try wide-leg jeans, these are a great option. M&S Collection Tweed Textured Single Breasted Blazer Tweed is a classic winter fabric, and this blazer nails it. It's versatile enough for both work and weekends. M&S Collection Leather Look Midi A-Line Skirt Wear with a black cashmere roll neck and some knee-high boots for an simple and elegant winter look. M&S Collection Soft Touch Knitted Longline Cardigan When comfort is key, this soft cardigan with deep pockets and a relaxed fit will be your go-to. This suede tote looks so much more expensive than it is. M&S Collection Pure Cotton T-Shirt A classic long-sleeved top is essential for layering when it's chilly. M&S Collection Faux Leather Cross Body Bag With its classic design and expensive-looking shade, this faux-leather crossbody could easily pass for designer. M&S Collection Supersoft Crew Neck Jumper A simple crew neck jumper will serve your winter wardrobe so well, and this one is available in 14 shades. It's ideal for desk-to-dinner days—just add dark-wash jeans and heeled boots to complete the look. M&S Collection Knitted Scarf Everyone needs a long, snuggly scarf for bundling up. M&S Collection Cable Knit Roll Neck Jumper The texture of this knit is a dream, and it comes in several easy-to-style muted shades. M&S Collection Embellished Tailored Waistcoat I couldn't not include a little festive piece in this edit! This waistcoat is just gorgeous, and will look just as good with a skirt (as proven above) as it will with jeans and trousers. M&S Collection Animal Print Longline Coat With Wool A luxe take on the leopard trend, this coat will add texture and warmth to any outfit. I'd throw it over jeans and a chunky knit for a relaxed look.
html:
Sponsor Content Created With M&S

With each new season comes a chance to give my wardrobe a little refresh, but let's be honest: most of us aren't here for an endless rotation of trends. Over the years, I've crafted a capsule wardrobe that relies on timeless staples. These pieces work hard year-round, but when winter rolls around, I love to add just a few select items that elevate the essentials I already own. For me, it's all about finding those refined, quietly luxurious pieces that seamlessly update my look without overpowering it. And truly, only a handful of high-street brands consistently deliver on this vision, with Marks and Spencer sitting firmly at the top of my list. The brand's winter collection is especially enticing this year—think effortless layers, rich textures and classic silhouettes that look and feel far more premium than their price tags suggest.

M&S has been my go-to for winter classics that keep me both cosy and chic for a few years now. There's something about the brand's approach to timeless design that just gets it right; every piece is well-made, comfortable and easy to style. I have a cashmere crew-neck jumper from last season that's seen me through countless dinners, events and off-duty weekends, and it still looks as impeccable as the day I bought it. And it's not just about style, it's the way these pieces fit into a busy lifestyle without feeling like high-maintenance fashion. The versatility and practicality of M&S pieces make them ideal for my winter wardrobe, especially as my calendar fills up with occasions where looking put-together is a must.

This season, I'm focusing on adding minimalist pieces that feel quietly expensive—the kind of items that whisper elegance rather than shout it. Think crisp tailoring, rich neutral hues and fabrics that elevate an outfit without much accessorising. Two of my standout picks are the Double Breasted Short Peacoat with Wool (£65), which is perfect for transitioning from casual lunches to evening events with ease, and the Cable Knit Roll Neck Jumper (£35) for the warmth and texture I crave in the colder months.

After spending a good few hours scouring the M&S website, below, I've rounded up my favourite winter pieces that exude that high-end feel.

Shop My Favourite Classic Winter Pieces From M&S:

M&S Collection

Double Breasted Short Peacoat With Wool

This pea coat has a slightly oversized yet tailored cut—ideal for layering over knits on cold days.

M&S Collection

High Waisted Crease Front Slim Flare Jeans

Jeans work hard year-round in my wardrobe, and I want to try a subtle flare cut this season.

Autograph

Pure Cashmere Textured Crew Neck Jumper

This super-soft jumper is available in a range of shades from oat to deep navy. I can see myself pairing it with tailored trousers or a leather skirt for multiple sophisticated, fuss-free winter looks.

M&S Collection

Lyocell Rich Pleated Wide Leg Trousers

A chic wide-leg silhouette that reminds me of classic Celine tailoring. These trousers come in black and grey and would look amazing with ankle boots and a tucked-in slim-fit roll neck.

Autograph

Wool Blend Pinstripe Cropped Blazer

Cropped blazers are a clever trick to make any outfit look more expensive. Plus, they're so easy to style with jeans or over a slip dress for an easy layered look.

Autograph

Wool Blend Pinstripe Tapered Trousers

The matching pinstripe trousers will turn it into a chic office look.

M&S Collection

Leather Chisel Toe Knee High Boots

These sleek knee-high boots are an example of timeless footwear that works with almost any outfit.

M&S Collection

Ribbed Roll Neck Jumper

Cosy yet refined, this jumper comes in a range of neutrals plus orange and green. The roll neck adds a little extra warmth without feeling too bulky, which also makes it perfect for layering.

M&S Collection

Single Breasted Longline Tailored Coat

This coat combines elegance and comfort with its single-breasted button fastening and oversized lapels. A classic pared-back outerwear option, you'll reach for it all season.

M&S Collection

The Wide-Leg Jeans

Affordable, versatile and not too wide, if you're yet to try wide-leg jeans, these are a great option.

M&S Collection

Tweed Textured Single Breasted Blazer

Tweed is a classic winter fabric, and this blazer nails it. It's versatile enough for both work and weekends.

M&S Collection

Leather Look Midi A-Line Skirt

Wear with a black cashmere roll neck and some knee-high boots for an simple and elegant winter look.

M&S Collection

Soft Touch Knitted Longline Cardigan

When comfort is key, this soft cardigan with deep pockets and a relaxed fit will be your go-to.

This suede tote looks so much more expensive than it is.

M&S Collection

Pure Cotton T-Shirt

A classic long-sleeved top is essential for layering when it's chilly.

M&S Collection

Faux Leather Cross Body Bag

With its classic design and expensive-looking shade, this faux-leather crossbody could easily pass for designer.

M&S Collection

Supersoft Crew Neck Jumper

A simple crew neck jumper will serve your winter wardrobe so well, and this one is available in 14 shades. It's ideal for desk-to-dinner days—just add dark-wash jeans and heeled boots to complete the look.

M&S Collection

Knitted Scarf

Everyone needs a long, snuggly scarf for bundling up.

M&S Collection

Cable Knit Roll Neck Jumper

The texture of this knit is a dream, and it comes in several easy-to-style muted shades.

M&S Collection

Embellished Tailored Waistcoat

I couldn't not include a little festive piece in this edit! This waistcoat is just gorgeous, and will look just as good with a skirt (as proven above) as it will with jeans and trousers.

M&S Collection

Animal Print Longline Coat With Wool

A luxe take on the leopard trend, this coat will add texture and warmth to any outfit. I'd throw it over jeans and a chunky knit for a relaxed look.
